answers.answer: Now don't get me wrong I love my baby, it's just this feeling I get that I feel less of a mother and women bcuz I didn't deliver vaginally :,(

Well, I am a mother of a beautiful little girl . & she was born on December 14th of 2010 . I had the same complications which was preeclampsia. . . I had her at 39 weeks, & All of this stuff happened to me. I do not regret having my baby via cesarean because, whenever January 3rd comes , I will be having a second one. . .
I felt like I had a Great surgery & an awesome recovery(:
Yes so did I after just a month I was feeling good and you can't really tell I had a cesarean. My doctor did a pretty neat surgery.. and Congrats on your coming baby

It sounds kind of like a depression. You are still a woman, you had complications and had to give birth someway. Okay, this is going to sound disgusting, but I've read somewhere about lions, and sometimes the females couldn't give birth to their cubs, so the father would rip them out of the mothers belly with tooth and claw. The mothers that lived and healed took care of their young just the same.

Well yea thanks, but I honestly don't think it's depression bcuz I'm fine over all, it's just this that keeps going through my mind :( && ohh it's not disgusting it's amazing what certain animals can do
I absolutely praise you as a motger for being able to come out of that surgery . Lots of mothers don't get to see their babies after they are born because they're no longer here.

I had one with my first and will be having another this time around. My water broke at 34 weeks so they started me on pitocin being that labor never started and I didn't dilate at all I was already 2 cm before my water breaking. My daughter didn't move an inch. The doctor advised me that it was probably best to get a c section bc it didn't I didn't dilate at all with pitocin.Think about it this way, your daughter had to get out some kinda way. Whether you pushed her out or not that doesn't make you any less of a mom/woman. Whenever you have another child you can always consider having a vbac!

Why is it that some women don't come out of this surgery? What goes wrong? I had this fear as the surgery was being done. I'm thankful to God for letting me be with my baby. && don't think I'm ignorant or something this was my first pregnancy, am not and expert on this but what is vbac?

I had a c section with my first due to him not reacting properly to the meds. Bunny just cause you didn't do vaginal doesn't mean you are not a woman. You carried that baby for 10 months you dealt with the contractions and all the other pain that came with it. Now if carrying a baby in your womb for 10 months an giving birth to it no matter how it comes out is not a woman then idk what is. Not everybody is the same just remember that.

question: Any ftm out there that had a cesarean??  This is my first child had her about 2 months ago. She was born at 38 wks because I had preeclamsia. went to hospital and was started with pitocin, my water broke hours later and was starting to dialet(spell check) I thought I was going to be able to give birth vaginally since everything was going smooth, and so did my doctor.. but after about 3 hrs of no difference made stuck at 8 cm my doctor said it was time, she had to be born. So I had the cesarean :( .. sometimes I feel like I'm not a women because I didn't give birth to my baby like all women are supposed to.. i know it's not true but I can't help it. And sometimes I don't even feel like a mother :'( actually I don't at all, could it be because of this? anybody else feeling like this?
title: dont feel much like a women
